creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: a small group of women in colorful kimono gathered in center near one story pagoda built atop a white rock-like structure with arch; towering, blossoming cherry tree with supports at L; foliage and low structures in background
marks: Left: [自摺　昭和拾年作　櫻八題　川越之櫻] {Jizuri, Shōwa jūnen sa LRC: [よし田] {Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: The Cherry Tree at Kawagoe
